summary: “He thought of Robb, with snowflakes melting in his hair. Kill the boy and let the man be born. He thought of Bran, clambering...
body:
“He thought of Robb, with snowflakes melting in his hair. Kill the boy and let the man be born. He thought of Bran, clambering up a tower wall, agile as a monkey. Of Rickon’s breathless laughter. Of Sansa, brushing out Lady’s coat and singing to herself. You know nothing, Jon Snow. He thought of Arya, her hair as tangled as a bird’s nest.“

- Jon Snow ( ADWD )

title: Spoilers below
body:
I just watched the leaks video and idk why so many people are worried about. Apparently what Sam says is that Daenerys doesn’t have or need to be queen bc Jon is the last living son of Rhaegar.

The situation about his brother has nothing to do with this statement.

summary: Aegon the Conqueror was the first known king in Westeros, who has made  “the shield of his people” and “protector of the Realm”...
body:
Aegon the Conqueror was the first known king in Westeros, who has made  “the shield of his people” and “protector of the Realm” his official titles (most likely because Targaryens united Westeros to prepare it for the coming of “the Doom of men”).

And now Jon and Dany - his descendants and the last Targaryens - are the key figures in the war with Others.

Like, history has come a full circle.

Like, history has come a full circle.

summary: "Jon, did you ever wonder why the men of the Night's Watch take no wives and father no children?" Maester Aemon...
body:
“Jon, did you ever wonder why the men of the Night’s Watch take no wives and father no children?” Maester Aemon asked.

Jon shrugged. “No.” He scattered more meat. The fingers of his left hand were slimy with blood, and his right throbbed from the weight of the bucket.

“So they will not love,” the old man answered, “for love is the bane of honor, the death of duty.”

That did not sound right to Jon, yet he said nothing. The maester was a hundred years old, and a high officer of the Night’s Watch; it was not his place to contradict him.

AGOT, Jon VIII

&

“Another lesson you should learn, if you hope to sit beside my son. Be gentle on a night like this and you’ll have treasons popping up all about you like mushrooms after a hard rain. The only way to keep your people loyal is to make certain they fear you more than they do the enemy.”

“I will remember, Your Grace,” said Sansa, though she had always heard that love was a surer route to the people’s loyalty than fear. If I am ever a queen, I'll make them love me.

ACOK, Sansa VI

One of my fav parallels. Not only these two scenes directly parallel each other by Jon and Sansa disagreeing with their mentors on the topic of love being the bane that makes men loyalty to institutions or their lords waver, but also Jon’s dialogue with Aemon has “take no wife and father no children” line (wink-wink) and it takes place right after his first attemp to desert the NW (and we know he will do so in the future); while Sansa’s has “if you ever hope to sit beside my son” (Joffrey is Jon’s foil; “One day, your husband will sit there, and you will sit by his side”) and “if I am ever a queen” lines.

summary: You might have talked about this before, but do you think Jon truly loved ygritte? P.S. Love your blog!<3
question: You might have talked about this before, but do you think Jon truly loved ygritte? P.S. Love your blog!<3
answer:
Show!Jon? Yes, I think he did. He was attracted to her and charmed by her from the get-go and that developed into his falling for her. There’s a deleted scene (s3, iirc) where he started heading back to CB one night only to return to the wildlings and lying down next to Ygritte. So he stayed with her longer than he needed and I think it shows he was very torn, that he did find some form of happiness with her. Also, he tells her he loves her and I don’t think that’s a lie. And Kit said in some interview or commentary that the smile Jon has when he sees Ygritte again (right before she dies) was his way of showing that Jon’s thought a lot about her since he left her and I definitely think Kit acted Jon in love throughout. That’s what he wanted to convey.

Jon knew it wasn’t a sustainable relationship, though. He knew it was just an escape, in a way, and that they were too different to have a future together. He knew his mission was important and he chose his vows and his brothers and his duty. But that doesn’t mean he didn’t love her. 

When it comes to book!jon, I don’t feel comfortable enough to expand, really, because I can’t remember much. All I remember is that I didn’t like the relationship or Ygritte, and I didn’t enjoy reading the chapters. My gut feeling is no, but honestly can’t back it up with anything solid.

Thanks, anon! <3

summary: Легенда о том, почему в Семи Королевствах больше нет королей
title: Легенда о том, почему в Семи Королевствах больше нет королей
description:
by Jess_L

В далеком будущем жители демократической республики Семь Королевств вспоминают древнюю историю.

Words: 1791, Chapters: 1/1, Language: Русский

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Original Characters
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
  • Additional Tags: Drama, Legends, Far Future, Post-Canon, Fanon

blog.description: We are enthusiastic and fantasy oriented people. We will deliver you all the stories and lore you need for your favorite fantasy universe, TV series, books, comics, and games.

summary: Game of Thrones Lore: History and Geography of House Footly
title: Game of Thrones Lore: History and Geography of House Footly
excerpt: House Footly of Tumbleton is a noble house from Tumbleton in the Reach. According to semi-canon sources, House Footly blazons their shields with a field of silver caltrops on black. Their motto is Tread Lightly Here.
